privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: At Synapse, your privacy is paramount. We've crafted this policy to give you transparency into how we collect, use, and protect your information, so you can use our platform with confidence.

infoCollect.heading: 1. Information We Collect
infoCollect.text: We collect information you provide directly when you create or update your account profile—such as your name, email address, and avatar image—as well as any content you submit (messages, photos, comments). Additionally, we automatically gather technical data about your device and usage, including your IP address, browser type and version, operating system, pages or features accessed, timestamps, and error logs. Finally, with your consent we may link external accounts (e.g., Google, Facebook) to streamline your login experience. Together, this data helps us personalize the service, detect misuse, and improve functionality over time.

useOfData.heading: 2. How We Use Your Data
useOfData.text: Your data enables core Synapse features: we deliver chat messages, generate photo analysis results, provide localized weather forecasts, and power analytics dashboards. We also analyze aggregated, de-identified usage patterns to understand feature adoption, troubleshoot bugs, and shape our product roadmap. From time to time, we may send you non-promotional service announcements or security alerts. You can opt out of marketing communications at any time via your account settings—however, transactional messages related to your account or critical updates will still reach you.

cookies.heading: 3. Cookies & Tracking Technologies
cookies.text: Synapse uses cookies, local storage, and similar technologies to remember your preferences (theme choice, language), maintain your session, and authenticate you securely. We partner with trusted analytics providers to collect anonymous usage metrics—such as daily active users, feature interaction rates, and performance statistics—to ensure the service is fast and reliable. You may disable or clear cookies through your browser settings, but doing so could break functionality (you might need to log in on every visit, for instance).

dataSharing.heading: 4. Data Sharing and Disclosure
dataSharing.text: We value your trust and do not sell or rent personal information to third parties. We may share your data with service providers under strict confidentiality agreements—for example, hosting infrastructure, payment processors, and analytics platforms. These providers are only permitted to use your data as necessary to perform services for Synapse. We may also disclose information if required by law, regulation, or valid legal process (such as a subpoena), or when we believe in good faith that disclosure is necessary to protect our rights, safety, or property, or that of our users.

security.heading: 5. Security Measures
security.text: We implement industry-standard security safeguards to protect your information both at rest and in transit. This includes TLS/SSL encryption for data transmission, AES-256 encryption for stored sensitive data, secure hashing of passwords, and regular penetration testing by independent auditors. Access to your personal data within our organization is restricted to employees and contractors who need it to perform their job functions, and they are bound by confidentiality obligations. While we strive for strong security, no system is infallible—please also safeguard your login credentials and enable two-factor authentication when available.

userRights.heading: 6. Your Rights and Choices
userRights.text: Depending on your jurisdiction, you may have the right to access, correct, update, or delete your personal data. You can review or modify most account information directly from your profile settings. To request deletion of data we cannot remove through the interface (for example, residual backups), please contact privacy@synapse.com. You may also object to or restrict certain processing activities, such as marketing or analytics. We will respond to valid requests in accordance with applicable data protection laws and may require identity verification before processing sensitive actions.

children.heading: 7. Children's Privacy
children.text: Synapse is intended for a general audience and is not directed at children under 13. We do not knowingly collect personal data from individuals below the minimum age in their country of residence. If we learn that we have inadvertently collected data from a child under 13 without verifiable parental consent, we will delete it as soon as possible. If you believe we may have any information from or about a child under 13, please contact us immediately at privacy@synapse.com.

international.heading: 8. International Data Transfers
international.text: Our servers and service providers may be located in countries outside your own, including the United States. If you reside in the European Economic Area or other regions with data protection regulations, please be aware that your information may be transferred internationally. We take steps—such as EU Standard Contractual Clauses—to ensure that your personal data receives an adequate level of protection when moved across borders, consistent with applicable laws.

retention.heading: 9. Retention of Data
retention.text: We retain your personal data for as long as necessary to provide our services, comply with legal obligations, resolve disputes, and enforce our agreements. Account deletion requests will remove your profile data and make your content inaccessible to others, though residual copies may remain in backup storage for a limited time before permanent erasure. Aggregated, anonymized analytics data may be retained indefinitely to help us improve and maintain the Synapse platform.

updates.heading: 10. Changes to This Privacy Policy
updates.text: We may update this Privacy Policy periodically to reflect changes in our practices, technology, legal requirements, or business operations. When substantive changes occur, we will post the revised policy with a new “Last Updated” date at the top. We encourage you to review the policy whenever you revisit the service. Continued use of Synapse after modifications constitutes acceptance of the updated terms.

terms.title: Terms & Conditions
terms.intro: Welcome to Synapse. These Terms & Conditions govern your use of our website, applications, and services supplied by Synapse. By creating an account or using our platform in any way, you agree to abide by these Terms. If you do not agree, please discontinue use immediately.

acceptance.heading: 1. Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.text: By accessing or using Synapse, you confirm that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by these Terms & Conditions and our Privacy Policy. These Terms constitute a binding legal agreement between you and Synapse. If you do not agree to all provisions, please do not use or access our services.

eligibility.heading: 2. Eligibility
eligibility.text: To register for an account, you must be at least 13 years old (or older if your local law requires a higher age). By creating an account, you represent that you meet this minimum age requirement. We reserve the right to suspend or terminate accounts that do not comply with this requirement.

accountSecurity.heading: 3. Account Registration & Security
accountSecurity.text: You may register by providing accurate personal information, including a valid email address. You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your credentials and for all activities that occur under your account. If you suspect unauthorized access, you should change your password immediately and notify us via support@synapse.com.

userConduct.heading: 4. User Conduct and Prohibitions
userConduct.text: You agree not to engage in any activity that could harm Synapse or other users. Prohibited behaviors include posting abusive or obscene content, distributing malware, impersonating others, attempting to reverse-engineer our systems, or using the service for unauthorized commercial purposes.

You may not reproduce, distribute, modify, or create derivative works without our express written permission.

privacyReference.heading: 7. Privacy and Data Practices
privacyReference.text: Your privacy is important to us. We collect and process personal data in accordance with our Privacy Policy, which explains what data we collect, how we use it, and your rights regarding that data. By using Synapse, you consent to the collection and use of information as described in the Privacy Policy.

availability.heading: 8. Service Availability & Updates
availability.text: While we aim for 99.9% uptime, we cannot guarantee uninterrupted access to the platform. Maintenance, updates, or unforeseen technical issues may cause temporary outages. We will attempt to notify you in advance for any planned maintenance but reserve the right to make emergency repairs without prior notice.

fees.heading: 9. Fees, Subscriptions & Payments
fees.text: Certain premium features may require payment of subscription fees. All fees are listed on our pricing page and charged in U.S. dollars unless otherwise indicated. By selecting a premium plan and providing your payment details, you authorize Synapse to charge your chosen payment method at the beginning of each billing cycle until you cancel.

cancellation.heading: 10. Cancellation & Account Termination
cancellation.text: You may cancel your subscription at any time through your account dashboard. Cancellation takes effect at the end of your current billing period. We reserve the right to suspend or terminate your account for any reason, including breach of these Terms or inactivity.

thirdParty.heading: 14. Third-Party Links & Integrations
thirdParty.text: The Service may contain links to third-party websites or services that are not owned or controlled by Synapse. We are not responsible for their content, privacy policies, or practices.

support.heading: 15. Support & Feedback
support.text: Feedback and support requests can be sent to support@synapse.com. While we strive to respond promptly, we cannot guarantee specific response times or outcomes.

modifications.heading: 16. Modifications to the Service
modifications.text: We may update, enhance, or discontinue features at our discretion, with or without notice. Your continued use of the Service following any changes constitutes acceptance of those changes.

termsChanges.heading: 17. Changes to Terms
termsChanges.text: We may revise these Terms at any time, with revisions becoming effective upon posting. The “Last Updated” date will reflect any changes. Continued use constitutes acceptance.

governingLaw.heading: 18. Governing Law & Dispute Resolution
governingLaw.text: These Terms are governed by the laws of the jurisdiction where Synapse is headquartered. Any dispute shall be resolved exclusively in the appropriate courts located there.

severability.heading: 19. Severability
severability.text: If any provision is held invalid, the remaining provisions will remain in full force and effect, and the invalid provision will be replaced by one that closely matches its intent.
